newsitem.title: SPAIN: Peseta debt/interbank market closing report.
newsitem.headline: Peseta debt/interbank market closing report.

text.p: Spanish government bonds closed slightly higher after heavy intra-day trade which lacked domestic impetus, dealers said.
"After Thursday's Bank of Spain cut, we saw a lot of profit taking going on," a dealer at Fimat Madrid said. The open interest contracts declined Thursday by 7.426 at 67.059.
"But anyway the market's mood is still positive," another added. Dealers were expecting good news on inflation.
Earlier, the Spanish central bank said there is "considerable scope" to reduce inflation and the market is eyeing the September CPI data, due next Friday.
The three-year bond 7.80 percent was trading at 102.29, up from Thursday's close at 102.00, while the 10-year benchmark was at 106.37, up from 106.31.

"We saw a steepening in the Spanish yield curve which is set to continue in the coming days," a dealer said. The 10-year spread above the German bunds was up at 184 from 172, while the differential over the two year part was at 322 from 324.
